DataElement.preferredDefinition: the indicator relating to the diagnosis of prior cancer.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to a prior cancer diagnosis.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Earlier in time or order.:A tumor composed of atypical neoplastic, often pleomorphic cells that invade other tissues.  Malignant neoplasms usually metastasize to distant anatomic sites and may recur after excision.  The most common malignant neoplasms are carcinomas (adenocarcinomas or squamous cell carcinomas), Hodgkin's and non-Hodgkin's lymphomas, leukemias, melanomas, and sarcomas. -- 2004

Concepts.definition: A neoplasm composed of atypical neoplastic, often pleomorphic cells that invade other tissues. Malignant neoplasms often metastasize to distant anatomic sites and may recur after excision. The most common malignant neoplasms are carcinomas, Hodgkin and non-Hodgkin lymphomas, leukemias, melanomas, and sarcomas.

Property.preferredDefinition: The process of identifying a disease by the signs and symptoms.

Concepts.definition: The investigation, analysis and recognition of the presence and nature of disease, condition, or injury from expressed signs and symptoms; also, the scientific determination of any kind; the concise results of such an investigation.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the process of identifying a disease by the signs and symptoms (NCI Glossary).

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: the indicator related to eligibility determinations.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Not known, not observed, not recorded, or refused.

Concepts.definition: Not known, observed, recorded; or reported as unknown by the data contributor.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Information regarding the subject is unknown or inaccessible at this time.

Concepts.definition: Information regarding the subject is unknown or inaccessible at this time.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.: Systematic, objective appraisal of the significance, effectiveness, and impact of activities or condition according to specified objectives and criteria.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.
Systematic, objective appraisal of the significance, effectiveness, and impact of activities or condition according to specified objectives and criteria.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Determination that a value is not relevant in the current context.

Concepts.definition: Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: trial-specific criteria that a patient must meet to be enrolled.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation. Indicators determine or aid in determining whether or not certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied. (On-line Medical Dictionary)

Concepts.definition: An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text3
ReferenceDocuments.description: Was the malignancy treated with curative intent >5 year

ReferenceDocuments.name: Patient has undergone potenti
ReferenceDocuments.description: Patient has undergone potentially curative therapy for all prior malignancies, No evidence of any prior malignancies for at least 5 years with no evidence of recurrence and is deemed to be at low risk for recurrence from prior malignancies

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text
ReferenceDocuments.description: If patient is a cancer survivor, all of the following criteria must be met Patient has undergone potentially curative therapy for all prior malignancies, No evidence of any prior malignancies for at least 5 years with no evidence of recurrence (except for successfully treated cervical carcinoma in situ, lobular carcinoma in situ of the breast, contralateral DCIS treated with mastectomy or lumpectomy and radiation but without tamoxifen treatment, or non-melanoma skin cancer with no evidence of recurrence), and Patient is deemed by their treating physician to be at low risk for recurrence from prior malignancies

ReferenceDocuments.name: DCP - History of other malignancy <2 years prior to the Registration/Randomization evaluation, with the exception of basal cell or squamous cell skin cancer
ReferenceDocuments.description: History of other malignancy <2 years prior to the Registration/Randomization evaluation, with the exception of basal cell or squamous cell skin cancer

ReferenceDocuments.name: WF1805CD
ReferenceDocuments.description: Diagnosed with a prior primary head and neck cancer.

ReferenceDocuments.name: Recurrent, persistent, or progressive disease at last assessment (per scan or clinical assessment).
ReferenceDocuments.description: Recurrent, persistent, or progressive disease at last assessment (per scan or clinical assessment).

ReferenceDocuments.name: COG CRF Text 1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Was the patient diagnosed with cancer prior to the cancer diagnoses that resulted in enrollment on this study?
